author: Balance Keeper
comment: I've been using this app for several years now, and I gotta tell you.... best app ever! It has been a lifesaver. If I hadn't been able to do the majority my programming while on the go, there's no way I would have made it through college. There's no question that without AIDE, I would not be the programmer I am today. In fact, I probably would not have been able to pursue programming at all.   Thank you AIDE developers!!

author: Nicholas Avila
comment: I like being able to learn these concepts in an easy to understand language. However, at some times, the system seems to assume that we know how something not yet taught should be done. I'm also upset that the lesson concerning backgrounds is locked as incomplete because there is no problem it keeps telling me there is. Overall though, pretty neat, I like it.

author: Isaac Morgan
comment: Cannot handle long lines of code. I paste in a string of only a few hundred characters and the app becomes unusable with visual glitches and unresponsiveness. File type doesn't matter (I tried putting the data in a separate file), the app simply can't handle 'long' lines.

author: Bruce Davidson
comment: Pretty much a waste of time. It's unable to compile my existing android studio projects, and doesn't give me any error messages. If you want to write a toy 'HelloWorld' I suppose it's adequate.

author: Richard
comment: It's amazing, I'm glad something like this exist. That that being said, I got this weird bug where it crashes after a save when you implement services. If the devs could look into it or at least tell me what's going on I'd appreciate it.

author: Smartphone David
comment: Was once a great app - isn't anymore. This was a very good app a few years ago, but it got so much worse that you can barely use it without buying the premium version (15€). Now you can't even save a file without having to pay. And the popup saying that you should buy the premium version comes up every few seconds. Also the support for this app got much worse over time. In 2014 there were updates nearly every week. Now this app only receives an update every few months. Please stop squeezing this app for money!

author: Patrick Chambon
comment: does not produce a release apk anymore... The result always have adrt folder and debug code included. I have been paying for this app for 2 years now and I am really disappointed that some update broke this... Please correct it for me to give back to your app the 5 stars it deserves.

author: Simon Morton
comment: I believe more more developers are now moving to Android Studio. Please let us have full interoperability with Studio please. Also a Navigation drawer would make things a lot less painful to get around. Apart from that Aide is the nearest thing to a usable mobile IDE.

author: Kyle McNerdFace
comment: Broken. Shows non-existent errors in the default projects, especially the libgdx game project, that don't allow it to compile.

author: Aaron Hazard
comment: SUBSCRIPTION REQUIRED. Aside from that;  Nice interface, clean setup, BUT...  The 1 free tutorial,  "hello world", the "instructions" did NOT initially include what it is that need to be ryped. In the lesson, The correct code needed is: _______________________ android:textsize="30sp" _______________________ BUT INSTEAD the app says: _______________________ (Hint: just type in the code textsi30sp _______________________ ↑That is literally what the app says!  IN WHAT WORLD DOES A NEW STUDENT KNOW WHAT THAT IS SUPPOSED TO MEAN? ARE YOU SERIOUSLY ASSUMING THE STUDENT KNOWS THIS?  If the only free lesson didn't have such a monumental mistake, I'd have already subscribed it. But please, give me a brake, Really?

author: Akansha Saxena
comment: It's not working at all , plus I'm typing something and something else gets printed and sometimes the whole thing gets erased. Please help and reply if I'm wrong
The free version did not save any of the classes that I wrote.  Well, it saved the class, but not the code inside the class.  Might as well install a text editor.  At least that would save my work.

author: Matt Jones
comment: I was forced to upgrade which I feel unfair but the full version of the app works well. Only one problem I have found is setting up libgdx projects with extensions

reply.author: appfour
reply.content: Hi Matt, thanks for the feedback, we are sorry for the inconvenience and will think about changes.

author: Giygas
comment: I wish you guys could turn off auto complete and auto correct. It keeps messing my typing up. It doesn't work properly.

reply.author: appfour
reply.content: This is a known issue with some specific keyboards and we are looking into it. You could try turning off text prediction or using another soft keyboard, like hacker's keyboard which is supported.

author: Bernard Aybout
comment: even after update when i compile apps malwarebytes, kaspersky and other antivirus programs detects malware  in my apps called  trojan.android.os.boogr.gsh. this thing is creating malware with the apps we compile.

reply.author: appfour
reply.content: We don't know anything about your issues. If crashes occur please send a bug report to support@appfour.com and we will investigate the problems.

author: Ahmad Ah
comment: I recommend this app to all Pakistani  specially if they interested in creating  android software and apps. Every developer should download and subscribe to this app.  The developers of this app wonderful but they should add some more topics in its teaching like how add new class or how to use expert mode. So new programmer can easily pick up advanced skill easily. The developer should add some features of Unreal Engine or Unity 3d too. I love this app. Once again all Pakistani should download and subscribe to this App.

author: Sam Wesley
comment: Can't even save Java files anymore without paying $15. Ridiculous.

author: Jordan Adcock
comment: Fixing my review in regards to this app as the team ended up responding with steps how to fix my concern.  The app is nice to use as it's a lot easier not to have to sit at a computer and code.  Spent hours creating what I created hope you all enjoy Red Birds Adventures. Thanks

author: skhumbuzo cele
comment: Hi. I have bought the paid version of this app. I have finished my Java lessons. I am now doing my Android app development lessons. When I submitt questions to the google+ community no one seems to care. Where how do I get support for this app courses? So that I may change your rating to a higher star...

reply.author: appfour
reply.content: Bug reports you can send to support@appfour.com. All other questions should get handled by the AIDE community or the AIDE forum.

author: Darren Griffiths
comment: What's the point of having a pro key if it still says unlock all features for £8.49 on startup in aide and the only thing I have not got is the debugger, surely should be £2.50 for debugger

author: Василий Луценко
comment: I like this app, but now I always get packaging error during run my program. I hope it will be fixed soon.

author: Ahmed Abdullah
comment: Hi, after create project in android in new android app, its showing trojent catched by antivirus.  Please advice me. Thanks

author: gokul jack
comment: I cant run the default hello wolrd program itself it shows "fix the errors underlined with red squiggly lines in your program" but i dont have any errors in program & also no red lines but it cant show output

author: Atlas Software
comment: I don't mind paying to support developers, but I swear I paid for this app back in the day and when I try to use it again I can't do anything without an in app purchase. Feels like the functionality has been paywalled over the years.

I've purchased a one year subscription this app last December. It is showing in my payment history but the subscription is not appearing in my account... It keeps asking me to purchase again! Please help.

author: Developer Bayman
comment: Well finally...im switching to JAVA-N IDE because it's free and ad free....i paid for AIDE but yet still getting nagged to death to spend more money...aide is the best  but the extra nagging isn't worth it

author: orm embar
comment: Too expensive: On top of buying an expensive App you are being asked to pay monthly for the courses - thats a bit much.

author: Adrian Tan
comment: Used to have premium license sponsored by Intel, now it askes me to buy without any way to restore the premium license

reply.author: appfour
reply.content: Hi Adrian, if you where approved for the INTEL Premium program in the past, please contact support@appfour.com for help.

author: manuel sintos
comment: Why it always show me an error in support.v4.Notification package. Does app support this local lib?

author: Vivek Raja
comment: This app shows error with code R.id.adView, can u say how to fix it

author: All Rounder
comment: New update isn't good. Abstraction is disappeared in new updates

author: Ck Carlyle
comment: The app has a lot of great features however, the keyboard doesn't appear on some devices. Would be perfect  if you could fix that.

author: Tosh Tab
comment: Paid for premium, liked it but now ad is in my face saying upgrade, I ALL READY BOUGHT PREMIUM.

reply.author: appfour
reply.content: Please contact support@appfour.com if your Premium Key does not get recognized.

author: Albrecht Müller
comment: I think it is a great idea. You guys just need to keep people informed on social media e. g. Twitter, etc. @AndroidIDE

author: Janice Didi
comment: Hi po sa appfour..maganda po ang app na ito, pero.. Bakit kapag nag build ako ng app ay ayaw ma install.. Sabi nya "app not installed"..

author: Michael Fennen
comment: App continues to crash. Galaxy note 8

author: Chris Spencer
comment: Carriage return, when the text cursor is directly to the right of the last character of a line, deletes the last character of the line  KIND OF A BIG BUG FOR A PAYED APP

author: Sergio Faveto
comment: I've tried in any way to get to the libraries (and in ALL environments it's as easy as "#include "), so now I think that if I'll find a way to get to the include files then I'll have to start almost the same struggle again to tell the linker where the library binaries are ... I'm starting to regret for the money I've paid :( PS: I know the libs are in /data/data/com.aide.ui/...blah...blah but setting paths in code or makefiles does not satisfy the compiler.

reply.author: appfour
reply.content:
In Files View: Add to Project  - chose Library . Please use our AIDE community if your issues are persisting. 
https://plus.google.com/u/0/communities/104927725094165066286?cfem=1

author: Saya Look
comment: Pretty good work have some problem but still  on android create a android Really cool stuff

author: fariz yudhistira hutama
comment: Please fix java skill lesson for loop, it cant run even the syntax has no error
